physical_appearance:This is a pair of blue velvet slippers. On each face
 there is an embroidery of elaborate foliate and lozenge motifs in gold-coloured metal threads. In the centre
 the slippers feature the figure of a rat. The slipper is covered with turquoise velvet. The slippers have low heels.

sgcool_label_text:The face of each slipper is embroidered with elaborate foliate and lozenge patterns in gold-coloured metallic thread. The central motif is a figure of a rat. The entire slipper is covered with a layer of turquoise-coloured velvet. The heel is low. This pair was probably made to be worn by a bride for silk and velvet were the preferred base for wedding shoes. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
